profileCard.title: Eric Liu
profileCard.description: My name is Eric Liu, I'm a third year student at the University of Waterloo, studying Computer Science and Combinatorics & Optimization. I'm primarily interested in full stack web development and distributed systems.

header.title: About Me.
header.subtitle: Who am I, what do I do?

header.title: Projects.
header.subtitle: Here are my finished projects and works in progress.

items.title: Algorithm Helper.
items.description: Web application for learning about algorithms, data structures, and other software engineering topics.

items.title: Kasparov Chess AI.
items.description: UCI compatible chess engine built in Java, uses bitboards, alpha-beta pruning, and quiescence search.

items.title: Wiki Graph Search.
items.description: Platform built in Node using Wikipedia to generate courses as a low-cost educational resource alternative.

items.title: Alexa MD.
items.description: Amazon Alexa app that uses the IBM Watson API to give diagnoses from voice commands.

items.title: Factable.
items.description: Uses natural language processing and machine learning to determine if an article is fake news.

items.title: Productive.
items.description: Chrome extension to help keep track of tasks, notes, shortcuts and productivity, with auto updating background.

items.title: Kneser-Ney Smoothing.
items.description: PyQt application to demonstrate the Kneser-Ney smoothing algorithm for bigram/word prediction.

items.title: tf-idf Text Summarizer.
items.description: JavaScript library for text summarization using tf-idf weighting.

items.title: Newstream.
items.description: Aggregates news and Tweets and applies sentiment analysis on various topics.

items.title: DFA.
items.description: JavaScript library for creating DFAs, NFAs, and epsilon-NFAs.

items.title: Porter Stemmer
items.description: JavaScript library that implements the Porter stemmer algorithm.

items.title: Minimum Spanning Tree
items.description: Visualization of Prim's and Kruskal's algorithm for finding the minimum spanning tree.

items.title: Convex Hull
items.description: Visualization of Graham's scan algorithm to find the convex hull of a set of points.
